intro: Mariscus pallens, commonly known as the pale mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Mariscus pallens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
